remarks: The predicate " ` F ` is a continuous function from topology ` J ` to topology ` K ` at point ` P ` ."  Based on Theorem 7.2(g) of [Munkres] p. 107.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Aug-2015.)
statement:
iscn.1 $e |- X = U. J $.
iscn.2 $e |- Y = U. K $.
iscnp2 $p |- ( F e. ( ( J CnP K ) ` P ) <-> ( ( J e. Top /\ K e. Top /\ P e. X ) /\ ( F : X --> Y /\ A. y e. K ( ( F ` P ) e. y -> E. x e. J ( P e. x /\ ( F " x ) C_ y ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d F x y $.
$d J x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d P x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d Y x y $.
